CONF_PARAM_1.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The CTS5 float mission is defined by a concatenation of elementary steps (see float manual for details).

CONF_PARAM_2.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Level of events stored in the associated log file ([0-3]).

CONF_PARAM_3.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Decimal and column separators for data files (*.csv)
CONF_PARAM_3.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The CTD can be transmitted in a CSV file. The first character of this parameter defines the decimal character to use, the second character defines the column separator to use.

CONF_PARAM_4.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: IP address of the float on a local connection via Bluetooth
CONF_PARAM_4.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: IP address of the float for a bluetooth connection.

CONF_PARAM_5.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: System task list: 0 – Float Integrity Test 1 – SBE41 navigation sensor 2 – Float safety mechanisms 3 – Standard navigation control 4 – Payload interaction 5 – GPS positioning 6 – Sensor acquisition 7 – NOSS navigation sensor 8 – SDA14 acoustic noise sensor 9 – Special mechanisms 10 – PUCK sensor 11 – EMAP sensor 12 – USEA interaction 13 – Under-ice capabilities
CONF_PARAM_5.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: List of tasks considered by the float (see float manual for details).

CONF_PARAM_6.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Enable/disable user log file generation and transmission.

CONF_PARAM_7.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Enable/disable system log file generation and transmission.

CONF_PARAM_8.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Perform a full auto-test (RUDICS server connection test) at float deployment (Yes=1/No=0).A full auto-test includes a connection test on the RUDICS server and a GPS fix acquisition.

CONF_PARAM_9.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Set the feedback risk level used to decide if a feedback, raised by the sensor board, should be accepted by the vector board (number between 0: lowest risk and 4:highest risk) (see float manual for details).

CONF_PARAM_10.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Enable/disable heavy float alarm. Heavy float alarm should be disabled if a 'heavy float deployment' is wanted.

CONF_PARAM_11.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: External pressure offset after effective surface only
CONF_PARAM_11.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The surface pressure offset is sampled only if an Iridium transmission or a GPS session occured (to be sure that the pressure offset is sampled at the surface). Original proposed names was: CONFIG_SecuredPressureOffsetSampledAtSurface_LOGICAL

CONF_PARAM_12.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Time stamping format for data files (*.csv)
CONF_PARAM_12.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The CTD can be transmitted in a CSV file. This parameter is used to set the format of the measurement times (0: seconds elapsed since 01/01/1900, 1: Excel format, 2: Unix format, 3: Mac format).

CONF_PARAM_13.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Mandatory additional memory card for the mission
CONF_PARAM_13.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: An additional memory card is requested for some missions (ex: under-ice mission). This parameter is designed to fail the autotest if the requested additional memory card is not present.

CONF_PARAM_14.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Rate of descent threshold for SV action (cm/s)
CONF_PARAM_14.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Float minimum descent speed before activating the valve.

CONF_PARAM_15.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Rate of ascent threshold for pump action (cm/s)
CONF_PARAM_15.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Float minimum ascent speed before activating the pump.

CONF_PARAM_16.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Descent speed during downcast (can be used to estimate the time to descent from parking pressure to profile pressure)

CONF_PARAM_17.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: ascent speed during upcast (can be used to estimate the profile duration).

CONF_PARAM_18.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Pressure tolerance for positioning in descent (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_18.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Defines the target pressure interval for float stabilisation at parking or profile depth (in dbars).

CONF_PARAM_19.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Pressure tolerance for positioning in ascent (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_19.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Defines the target pressure interval for float stabilisation during ascent at a prescribed depth. The prescibed depth could be the PRES threshold to start low ascent (but I think this should not be in the definition which should stay more generic).

CONF_PARAM_20.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Pressure tolerance before repositioning in park (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_20.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Defines the target pressure interval for float drift at parking or profile depth (in dbars).

CONF_PARAM_21.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Pressure tolerance for positioning in park (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_21.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Defines the target pressure interval before performing a buoyancy readjustment to reposition during the drift at parking depth. When a PRES measurement (sampled to monitor the float drift at parking depth) is outside the [parking_pressure +- CONFIG_PressureTargetToleranceBeforeReposition_dbar] interval, the float adjust its buoyancy.

CONF_PARAM_22.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Period of the pressure checks during the float descent (after CONFIG_BuoyancyReductionSecondThreshold_dbar).

CONF_PARAM_23.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Period of the pressure checks during the float ascent to surface.

CONF_PARAM_24.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Period of the pressure checks during the float drift at park or profile depth.

CONF_PARAM_25.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Maximum volume of an SV action during descent/repositioning (cm3)
CONF_PARAM_25.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: This information is used as a threshold for the valve action durations. The valve flow is known for each float and CONFIG_OilVolumeMaxPerValveAction_cm^3 is converted to a maxDurationOfValveAction.  During descent phases the float regularly computes a valve duration to sink to the target depth. In some specific cases the result can be a huge valve action duration and the result must be thresholded by maxDurationOfValveAction.

CONF_PARAM_26.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Maximum volume of a pump action during repositioning (cm3)
CONF_PARAM_26.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: This information is used as a threshold for the pump action duration for reposition in the parking drift interval. The pump flow is known for each float and CONFIG_OilVolumeMaxPerPumpActionReposition_cm^3 is converted to a maxDurationOfPumpActionReposition.  When a reposition should be performed, the float computes the needed pump action duration. In some specific cases the result can be a huge pump action duration and the result must be thresholded by maxDurationOfPumpActionReposition.

CONF_PARAM_27.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: First threshold of the buoyancy reduction phase (see float manual for explanations).

CONF_PARAM_28.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Second threshold of the buoyancy reduction phase  (see float manual for explanations).

CONF_PARAM_29.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Fixed volume of a pump action during ascent (cm3)
CONF_PARAM_29.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Nominal oil volume of each pump action during ascent.

CONF_PARAM_30.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Fixed volume of a pump action during braking (cm3)
CONF_PARAM_30.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Nominal oil volume of each pump action during descent (when the float brakes because of a too fast descent speed).

CONF_PARAM_31.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: SV activation time during phase 2 of emergence reduction (cs)
CONF_PARAM_31.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Duration of the valve actions during the second phase of the buoyancy reduction (between CONFIG_BuoyancyReductionFirstThreshold_dbar and CONFIG_BuoyancyReductionSecondThreshold_dbar).

CONF_PARAM_32.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: SV activation factor during phase 2 of emergence reduction
CONF_PARAM_32.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Define the period of valve actions during the second phase of the buoyancy reduction (between CONFIG_BuoyancyReductionFirstThreshold_dbar and CONFIG_BuoyancyReductionSecondThreshold_dbar). The valve is open during CONFIG_ValveTimeActionBuoyancyReduction_csec each CONFIG_ValveTimeActionBuoyancyReduction_csec*CONFIG_ValveActionPeriodFactorBuoyancyReduction_NUMBER.

CONF_PARAM_33.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Volume of the last pump action of the buoyancy acquisition phase. Original proposed name was: CONFIG_PumpActionOilVolumeBuoyancyAcquisition_cm^3

CONF_PARAM_34.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Threshold used by the float to stop ascent speed control and pump actions.

CONF_PARAM_35.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Deceleration during ascent (0 = none, 1 = low, 5 = high)
CONF_PARAM_35.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: This factor defines the speed of the ascent phase (between 0: nominal speed and 5: lowest speed).

CONF_PARAM_36.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Braking power in ascent abortion (multiplies P15)
CONF_PARAM_36.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: This factor defines the oil volume transferred from the external bladder when a profile evasion occurs and the float has to brake. The transferred oil volume is CONFIG_ProfileEvasionAscentSpeedFactor_NUMBER times the oil volume of the last pump action.

CONF_PARAM_37.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Pressure tolerance before repositioning in park (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_37.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Defines the target pressure interval, during phase #<I> of multi-parking mode, for float drift at parking or profile depth (in dbars).

CONF_PARAM_38.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Pressure tolerance for positioning in park (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_38.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Defines the target pressure interval, during phase #<I> of multi-parking mode, before performing a buoyancy readjustment to reposition during the drift at parking depth. When a PRES measurement (sampled to monitor the float drift at parking depth) is outside the [parking_pressure +- CONFIG_PressureTargetToleranceBeforeReposition_dbar] interval, the float adjust its buoyancy.

CONF_PARAM_39.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Number of multi-parking phases (up to 5 for Provor CTS5 floats). Do Not Use multi-parking CONFIGs if there is only a single, mono drift target throughout the life of a float. If a float has both mono-parking and multi-parking cycles, fill CONFIG_ParkPressure with fillvalue in multi-parking cycles.

CONF_PARAM_40.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: park pressure - this may change if the float is reprogrammed and must be reported in the mission configuration settings

CONF_PARAM_41.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: park pressure of multi-parking phase #<I> - this may change if the float is reprogrammed and must be reported in the mission configuration settings

CONF_PARAM_42.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: profile pressure - this may change if the float is reprogrammed and must be reported in the mission configuration settings

CONF_PARAM_43.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: For APEX and ARVOR floats this is the total duration of one cycle, usually 240 hours (10 days). For SOLO floats this is the total duration of one cycle, assuming that all float operations reach their full time-out intervals before moving to the next float stage. Typically the actual cycle time will be shorter than this value.

CONF_PARAM_44.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Time of presence at the surface
CONF_PARAM_44.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Time of day of float surfacing - could be hour of the float surfacing or could be stored as seconds when set as hh:mm:ss (e.g. for PROVOR CTS5)

CONF_PARAM_45.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The float performs a GPS session to acquire a GPS fix at the end of the cycle (Yes=1/No=0).

CONF_PARAM_46.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The float performs a telemetry transmission at the end of the cycle (Yes=1/No=0).

CONF_PARAM_47.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Duration of the park phase #<I> in multi-parking mode

CONF_PARAM_48.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Min threshold of battery level before raising a low battery no load alarm.

CONF_PARAM_49.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Max threshold of internal pressure level before raising a high internal pressure alarm.

CONF_PARAM_50.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Detection threshold for inconsistent external pressure jumps (cm/s)
CONF_PARAM_50.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Max threshold of vertical speed level before raising a External pressure sensor failure alarm.

CONF_PARAM_51.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Min threshold of external pressure before raising a Low external pressure alarm.

CONF_PARAM_52.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Detection threshold for high external pressure / pressure limit (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_52.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Max threshold of external pressure before raising a High external pressure alarm.

CONF_PARAM_53.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Detection of broken external pressure sensor (successive errors)
CONF_PARAM_53.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Max number of successive errors from the external pressure sensor before raising a External pressure sensor failure alarm.

CONF_PARAM_54.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Detection threshold for grounding during descent (cm3)
CONF_PARAM_54.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: This information is a threshold used to detect a grounding of the float. If there is no vertical motion after having tranferred CONFIG_OilVolumeMinForGroundingDetection_cm^3 through the valve, the gounded flag is activated and the float acts as configurated by the CONFIG_GroundingMode_LOGICAL parameter.So, yes it is a configuration parameter (and I can easily understand that it can be modified via remote control since some PROVOR floats have experienced erroneous grounding detection (under study but perhaps due to in-situ conditions).

CONF_PARAM_55.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Detection threshold for snagging during ascent (cm3)
CONF_PARAM_55.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: This information is a threshold used to detect a hanging of the float. If there is no ascent vertical motion after having tranferred CONFIG_OilVolumeMinForHangingDetection_cm^3 through the pump the hanged alarm is activated.

CONF_PARAM_56.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Detection of high rate of descent (braking)
CONF_PARAM_56.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Max threshold of descent speed before raising a braking alarm.

CONF_PARAM_57.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Low battery voltage detection threshold (min. on pump) (V)
CONF_PARAM_57.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Min threshold of battery level before raising a low battery load alarm.

CONF_PARAM_58.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Delay time at surface SA stage before loop (s)
CONF_PARAM_58.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Surface temporization (step 'SA' of the mission) before loops ([0-86400 (24 h)]) (see float manual for details).

CONF_PARAM_59.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Delay time at surface SA stage in pattern loop (s)
CONF_PARAM_59.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Surface temporization (step 'SA' of the mission) during pattern loops ([0-7200 (2 h)]) (see float manual for details).

CONF_PARAM_60.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Delay time at surface SA stage in cycle loop (s)
CONF_PARAM_60.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Surface temporization (step 'SA' of the mission) during cycle loops ([0-7200 (2 h)]) (see float manual for details).

CONF_PARAM_61.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Test temporization (step 'TC' of the mission) ([0-600 (10 min)]) (see float manual for details).

CONF_PARAM_62.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Enable/disable GPS position acquisition at end of life
CONF_PARAM_62.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The float performs a GPS session to acquire a GPS fix in each End Of Life transmission (Yes=1/No=0).

CONF_PARAM_63.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Transmission period at end of life (s)
CONF_PARAM_63.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Period of the Iridium transmission when in End Of Life mode (in minutes).

CONF_PARAM_64.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: List of alarms that can cause end of life (alarms 18 and 19 cannot be modified)
CONF_PARAM_64.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: List of alarms which can make the float transitioning to the End Of Life mode.

CONF_PARAM_65.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Management method for grounding detection during descent parking
CONF_PARAM_65.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Action performed by the float when a grounding is detected. 0: the float changes its drift pressure, 1: the float stays on the seabed until the next phase of the cycle. For PROVOR CTS5 the number assigned to each mode has changed - see float manual for details for this model.

CONF_PARAM_66.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Set point offset in case of grounding management by correction (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_66.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: If in grounding mode 0, the float changes its drift pressure to its programmed one minus this value only if its current pressure is greater than this value.

CONF_PARAM_67.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Detection management method for snagging during ascent
CONF_PARAM_67.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Action performed by the float when a hanging is detected (see float manual for details). [JP additional comments on behaviour for PROVOR floats: The hanging mode is the same idea as the grounding mode but for an ascent phase. When the float detects a too low vertical motion after having activated its pump to try to ascend it enters in a hanging mode (it is probably stuck at the sea floor). This parameter configures (with the same idea as CONFIG_GroundingMode_NUMBER for grounding) what should be the actions to perform to try to escape from hanging (it can activate its pump and valve alternatively to try to escape or abandon the ascent and switch to the next scheduled task].

CONF_PARAM_68.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Minimum pressure for correction in case of grounding detection
CONF_PARAM_68.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: If in grounding mode 0, the float changes its drift pressure only if its current pressure is greater than this value.

CONF_PARAM_69.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Management method for grounding detection during descent profile
CONF_PARAM_69.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Action performed by the float when a grounding is detected during descent to profile depth. For PROVOR CTS5 floats: 2: the float stays on the seabed until the ascent start time, 3: the ascent starts immediately.

CONF_PARAM_70.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Depth for slow start of ascent (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_70.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Pressure threshold to start the slow ascent speed phase.

CONF_PARAM_71.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Cycle periodicity of the in air measurement phase: - 0 means no in air acquisition - 1 means in air acquisition every cycle - N means in air acquisition one cycle every N cycles

CONF_PARAM_72.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Duration of the in air measurement phase.

CONF_PARAM_73.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Depth for slow start of ascent (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_73.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Pressure threshold to start the slow ascent speed phase.

CONF_PARAM_74.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Depth for execution of ice detection test (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_74.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Pressure threshold to start the acoustic ice detection test.

CONF_PARAM_75.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Duration of the ice detection test.

CONF_PARAM_76.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Depth for slow start of ascent (dbar)
CONF_PARAM_76.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Pressure threshold to start the slow ascent speed phase.

CONF_PARAM_77.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Maximum duration period without trying a transmission session (s)
CONF_PARAM_77.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Maximum delay (in month) of no transmission due to the ice detection algorithm. This parameter is used to disable the ice detection algorithmand force the float to surface even if ice is detected.

CONF_PARAM_78.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Systematic abort profile period after ISA detection (s)
CONF_PARAM_78.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Maximum delay (in days) since the last ice evasion date due to an ISA detection.  This is often called the 'Spring', where the float stays underwater for a time even though the temperature has warmed.

CONF_PARAM_79.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Systematic abort profile period after collision or cover detection (s)
CONF_PARAM_79.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Maximum delay (in days) since the last ice evasion date due to a surface Ice cap detection.

CONF_PARAM_80.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Maximum sampling pressure used by ice cover detection algorithm. i.e. start pressure threshold for ice detection algorithm)

CONF_PARAM_81.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Minimum sampling pressure used by ice cover detection algorithm. (i..e end pressure threshold for ice detection algorithm)

CONF_PARAM_82.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Ice temperature in [degree Celsius/1e3] where profiles are aborted because of ice formation conditions

CONF_PARAM_83.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Number of consecutive ISA detections before float surface inhibition.If fewer consecutive ice detections are made, then the float will immediately seek the surface if mixed layer temp is warm.

CONF_PARAM_84.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: DNIS number associated with the SIM card
CONF_PARAM_84.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: DNIS number of the SIM card of the float.

CONF_PARAM_85.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Login of account associated with float (on the server)

CONF_PARAM_86.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Serial port number used by the Iridium device.

CONF_PARAM_87.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Connection time-out, i.e. maximum transmission period for one telemetry session

CONF_PARAM_88.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Max size for transmitted files (in kbyte). Larger files are split before transmission.

CONF_PARAM_89.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Format of the transmitted CTD data (0: CSV format, 1: extended hex format, 2: standard hex format) (see float manual for details).

CONF_PARAM_90.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: File transmission mode (standard, extended, high speed)
CONF_PARAM_90.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: File transmission mode (0: standard, 1: extended, 2: streaming).

CONF_PARAM_91.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Iridium registration maximum time before abort (s)
CONF_PARAM_91.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Iridium registration time-out (used to abort an Iridium session before CONFIG_ConnectionTimeOut_second).

CONF_PARAM_93.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Total oil volume in the hydraulic system (cm3)
CONF_PARAM_93.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Total volume of oil in the hydraulic device.

CONF_PARAM_94.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Serial port number used by the sensor board.

CONF_PARAM_95.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Power output port number used by the sensor board.

CONF_PARAM_96.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Ask/inform the sensor board during hydraulic adjustments.

CONF_PARAM_98.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Serial port number used by the EMAP (USEA controller board).

CONF_PARAM_99.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Power output port number used by the EMAP (USEA controller board).

CONF_PARAM_100.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: USEA’s sensor list: 2  -> DO 3  -> OCR 4  -> ECO 5  -> SBEPH 6  -> CROVER 7  -> SUNA 8  -> UVP6 12 -> ECOv2 13 -> EXTTRIG 14 -> RAMSES 15 -> OPUS 17 -> MPE 18 – HYDROC 20 – IMU 21 – RAMSES-2
CONF_PARAM_100.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: List of sensors managed by the USEA card (2:DO, 3:OCR, 4:ECO, 5:SBEPH, 6:CROVER, 7:SUNA, 8:UVP6, 12:ECOv2, 13:ExtTrig, 14:RAMSES, 15:OPUS, 17:MPE, 18:HYDROC, 20:IMU, 21:RAMSES-2).

CONF_PARAM_101.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Serial port number used by the GPS device.

CONF_PARAM_102.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Power output port number used by the GPS device.

CONF_PARAM_103.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: When the float Real Time Clock is set, also set the clock of the measurement card.

CONF_PARAM_104.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Use the GPS improved location mode. This mode can be used when the float altitude is 0 meter, it provides better locations.

CONF_PARAM_105.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Set the float Real Time Clock with GPS time.

CONF_PARAM_106.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Zone 1 - Sampling period / descent to drift depth (s)
CONF_PARAM_106.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Sampling period of the <short_sensor_name> during the descent to parking pressure in the depth zone #<N> (in seconds).

CONF_PARAM_107.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Zone 1 - Sampling period / descent to drift depth (s)
CONF_PARAM_107.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Sampling period of the <short_sensor_name> during the descent to parking pressure in the depth zone #<N> (in seconds).

CONF_PARAM_108.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Zone 1 - Sampling period / parking depth drift (s)
CONF_PARAM_108.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Sampling period of the <short_sensor_name> during the drift at parking pressure in the depth zone #<N>.

CONF_PARAM_109.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Zone 1 - Sampling period / parking depth drift (s)
CONF_PARAM_109.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Sampling period of the <short_sensor_name> during the drift at parking pressure in the depth zone #<N>.

CONF_PARAM_110.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Zone 1 - Sampling period / descent to measurement depth (s)
CONF_PARAM_110.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Sampling period of the <short_sensor_name> during the descent to profile pressure in the depth zone #<N> (in seconds).

CONF_PARAM_111.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Zone 1 - Sampling period / descent to measurement depth (s)
CONF_PARAM_111.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Sampling period of the <short_sensor_name> during the descent to profile pressure in the depth zone #<N> (in seconds).

CONF_PARAM_112.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Zone 1 - Sampling period / measurement depth drift (s)
CONF_PARAM_112.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Sampling period of the <short_sensor_name> during the drift at profile pressure in the depth zone #<N>.

CONF_PARAM_113.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Zone 1 - Sampling period / measurement depth drift (s)
CONF_PARAM_113.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Sampling period of the <short_sensor_name> during the drift at profile pressure in the depth zone #<N>.

CONF_PARAM_114.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Sampling period of the <short_sensor_name> during the ascending profile in the depth zone #<N> (in seconds).

CONF_PARAM_115.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Sampling period of the <short_sensor_name> during the ascending profile in the depth zone #<N> (in seconds).

CONF_PARAM_116.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Power acquisition mode of the <short_sensor_name> in the depth zone #<N> (0 : none, 2 : pulsed, 3 : continuous).

CONF_PARAM_117.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Power acquisition mode of the <short_sensor_name> in the depth zone #<N> (0 : none, 2 : pulsed, 3 : continuous).

CONF_PARAM_118.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Data processing output of the <short_sensor_name> in the depth zone #<N>  (see float manual for details).

CONF_PARAM_119.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Data processing output of the <short_sensor_name> in the depth zone #<N>  (see float manual for details).

CONF_PARAM_120.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Data of the <short_sensor_name> can be reported as they have been sampled or synchronized with one CTD parameter (PRES or TEMP or PSAL). The synchronization is done with the timely closest sample of the CTD (see float manual for details).

CONF_PARAM_121.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Data of the <short_sensor_name> can be reported as they have been sampled or synchronized with one CTD parameter (PRES or TEMP or PSAL). The synchronization is done with the timely closest sample of the CTD (see float manual for details).

CONF_PARAM_122.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Slices thickness for <short_sensor_name> in the depth zone #<N> (in dbar).

CONF_PARAM_123.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Slices thickness for <short_sensor_name> in the depth zone #<N> (in dbar).

CONF_PARAM_124.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Threshold between depth zone #N and depth zone #N+1 for <short_sensor_name>  (in dbar).

CONF_PARAM_125.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Threshold between depth zone #N and depth zone #N+1 for <short_sensor_name>  (in dbar).

CONF_PARAM_126.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Time, needed after the <short_sensor_name> is powered ON, to provide its first sample (in milli-seconds).

CONF_PARAM_127.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Time, needed after the <short_sensor_name> is powered ON, to provide its first sample (in milli-seconds).

CONF_PARAM_128.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Minimum waiting time needed by the <short_sensor_name> between a switch OFF and a switch ON (in milli-seconds).

CONF_PARAM_129.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Minimum waiting time needed by the <short_sensor_name> between a switch OFF and a switch ON (in milli-seconds).

CONF_PARAM_130.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Filtering index of first valid sample
CONF_PARAM_130.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Rank of the first valid sample provided by the <short_sensor_name> (0 is the rank of the first sample).

CONF_PARAM_131.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Filtering index of first valid sample
CONF_PARAM_131.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Rank of the first valid sample provided by the <short_sensor_name> (0 is the rank of the first sample).

CONF_PARAM_132.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Sampling period for the <short_sensor_name> sensor during the in air measurement phase.

CONF_PARAM_133.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Sampling period for the <short_sensor_name> sensor during the in air measurement phase.

CONF_PARAM_134.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The pressure at which the CTD pump is switched off.  As the float ascends, the code looks at the pressure and if <= CONFIG_CTDPumpStopPressure, the CTD is turned off. CTDPumpStopPressure is a firmware threshold and as such, data may continue to be collected for a limited span after the threshold is recognized. Especially in floats that return high resolution discrete data, there might be data collected shallower than the cut off, due to the discrete nature of the pressure data and also due to the time necessary for the firmware to turn off the CTD once the pressure threshold is reached. For example for SOLOII floats the CTD is switched off at 1dbar, and typically the shallowest data is from 0.5 to 0.8 dbar. This shallow data should be carefully assessed for its validity.

CONF_PARAM_135.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Configure CTD to 1 Hz sampling instead of 0.5 Hz usual one.

CONF_PARAM_136.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Number of  the UVP sensor configuration for the DepthZone<N>. The configuration is defined by UVP_ACQ_CONF_XX_PARAMETERS, where XX is the configuration number.

CONF_PARAM_137.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Number of  the UVP sensor configuration for the park drift phase. The configuration is defined by UVP_ACQ_CONF_XX_PARAMETERS, where XX is the configuration number.

CONF_PARAM_138.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Parking depth drift – Image count for average
CONF_PARAM_138.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Number of averaged images by the UVP sensor for the park drift phase.

CONF_PARAM_139.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Sampling period of the UVP during the park drift phase (in seconds).

CONF_PARAM_140.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Pixel start: index of the first wavelength transmitted in full resolution. The size of the transmitted RAMSES spectrum can be adapted by the user according to his need. It is possible to select the transmitted spectrum and also to extend it with a binned resolution subset for higher wavelengths.

CONF_PARAM_141.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Pixel end: index of the last wavelength transmitted in binned resolution. The size of the transmitted RAMSES spectrum can be adapted by the user according to his need. It is possible to select the transmitted spectrum and also to extend it with a binned resolution subset for higher wavelengths.

CONF_PARAM_142.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Binning size: number of wavelengths averaged in binned resolution subset of the spectrum. The size of the transmitted RAMSES spectrum can be adapted by the user according to his need. It is possible to select the transmitted spectrum and also to extend it with a binned resolution subset for higher wavelengths.

CONF_PARAM_143.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Pixel start: index of the first wavelength transmitted in full resolution. The size of the transmitted OPUS spectrum can be adapted by the user according to his need. It is possible to select the transmitted spectrum and also to extend it with a binned resolution subset for higher wavelengths.

CONF_PARAM_144.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Pixel pivot: index of the last wavelength transmitted in full resolution. The binned resolution subset starts at Pixel pivot+1. The size of the transmitted OPUS spectrum can be adapted by the user according to his need. It is possible to select the transmitted spectrum and also to extend it with a binned resolution subset for higher wavelengths.

CONF_PARAM_145.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Pixel end: index of the last wavelength transmitted in binned resolution. The size of the transmitted OPUS spectrum can be adapted by the user according to his need. It is possible to select the transmitted spectrum and also to extend it with a binned resolution subset for higher wavelengths.

CONF_PARAM_146.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Binning size: number of wavelengths averaged in binned resolution subset of the spectrum. The size of the transmitted OPUS spectrum can be adapted by the user according to his need. It is possible to select the transmitted spectrum and also to extend it with a binned resolution subset for higher wavelengths.

CONF_PARAM_147.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: OPUS acquisition mode can either be 'calibrated' (configuration value = 2) or 'raw' (configuration value = 4) during descent or ascent phases. In 'calibrated' mode, Light spectra are corrected for Dark and Sensor Temperature onboard the OPUS and recorded as 'calibrated' LGT spectra. In 'raw' mode, raw Light spectra are recorded as 'raw' LGT spectra. In 'raw' mode, Dark spectra are taken separately and recorded as BLK with mean and standard deviation between Pixel Start and Pixel Pivot. During Parking and Surface phases, light spectra are recorded in 'raw' mode.

CONF_PARAM_148.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: During descent and ascent phases, in case of 'raw' light spectrum acquisition mode, an additional raw dark spectrum is acquired automatically with successive spectrum acquisitions. The measurement interval 'DarkSubsampling' is selected by the user independently for each zone. 0 means no raw dark spectrum BLK is acquired. 1-200 means a raw dark spectrum BLK is acquired every 1 to 200 LGT spectrum acquisitions. During Parking and Surface phases, a raw dark spectrum is acquired before each raw light spectrum acquisition.

CONF_PARAM_149.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Duration of the sensor Warm-up phase

CONF_PARAM_150.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Duration of the sensor Zero phase

CONF_PARAM_151.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Duration of the sensor Flush phase

CONF_PARAM_152.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Data bin duration over which data during Warm-up phase are averaged

CONF_PARAM_153.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Data bin duration over which data during Zero phase are averaged

CONF_PARAM_154.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Data bin duration over which data during Flush phase are averaged

CONF_PARAM_155.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Pixel start: index of the first wavelength transmitted in full resolution. The size of the transmitted RAMSES spectrum can be adapted by the user according to his need. It is possible to select the transmitted spectrum and also to extend it with a binned resolution subset for higher wavelengths.

CONF_PARAM_156.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Pixel end: index of the last wavelength transmitted in binned resolution. The size of the transmitted RAMSES spectrum can be adapted by the user according to his need. It is possible to select the transmitted spectrum and also to extend it with a binned resolution subset for higher wavelengths.

CONF_PARAM_157.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Binning size: number of wavelengths averaged in binned resolution subset of the spectrum. The size of the transmitted RAMSES spectrum can be adapted by the user according to his need. It is possible to select the transmitted spectrum and also to extend it with a binned resolution subset for higher wavelengths.

CONF_PARAM_158.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: If there is no need to reach the surface (cycle with no transmission phase), the float can start a new descent phase as soon as the 2 dbar thresold is reached (instead of waiting 10 minutes after the crossing of the CONFIG_AscentEndThreshold_dbar threshold).

CONF_PARAM_159.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: If there is no need to reach the surface (cycle with no transmission phase), the float can brake after the crossing of the CONFIG_AscentEndThreshold_dbar threshold and start a new descent phase.

CONF_PARAM_161.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: depth at which float is set to pressure activate

CONF_PARAM_162.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Maximum duration of the pressure test (s)
CONF_PARAM_162.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The pressure activation phase starts after the first successfull auto-test and ends (with the start of the float mission) at the end of the CONFIG_AUX_PressureActivationTimeout_seconds period. During this phase the float checks the external pressure and can start its mission as soon as a CONFIG_PressureActivation_dbar pressure is measured.

CONF_PARAM_163.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Count to volt conversion for battery measurements: counts measurement for the first calibration point.

CONF_PARAM_164.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Count to volt conversion for battery measurements: counts measurement for the second calibration point.

CONF_PARAM_165.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Count to volt conversion for battery measurements: volts measurement for the first calibration point.

CONF_PARAM_166.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Count to volt conversion for battery measurements: volts measurement for the second calibration point.

CONF_PARAM_167.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Count to mbar conversion for internal pressure measurements: counts measurement for the first calibration point.

CONF_PARAM_169.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Count to mbar conversion for internal pressure measurements: mbar measurement for the first calibration point.

CONF_PARAM_170.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Count to mbar conversion for internal pressure measurements: mbar measurement for the second calibration point.

CONF_PARAM_203.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Firmware version of the OPUS sensor

CONF_PARAM_204.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Serial number of the OPUS sensor lamp module

CONF_PARAM_205.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Length of the OPUS Lamp spectrum

CONF_PARAM_206.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: Intensities of the OPUS Lamp spectrum

CONF_PARAM_207.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The number of internal optical sensor measurements that are averaged to generate a reported data point from the MPE optical sensor.

CONF_PARAM_208.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The rate in Hz at which the internal optical sensor is making measurements. The Rate parameter combined with the Average parameter sets the effective output rate of reported data points from the MPE sensor (If Average = 123, and Rate = 125, then MPE output rate is approximately 1Hz).

CONF_PARAM_209.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The responsivity in raw MPE output per calibrated units for the optical sensor in Water.  To calibrate data collected in water, divide the MPE optical sensor output by ResponsivityW.

CONF_PARAM_210.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The responsivity in raw MPE output per calibrated units for the optical sensor in Air. To calibrate data collected in air, divide the MPE optical sensor output by ResponsivityA.

CONF_PARAM_211.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The ratio of gains between the High and Medium stages of the MPE optical sensor electronics. For data traceability only. Not necessary for data processing.

CONF_PARAM_212.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The ratio of gains between the Medium and Low stages of the MPE optical sensor electronics. For data traceability only. Not necessary for data processing.

CONF_PARAM_213.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The High gain stage offset internally applied in the MPE optical sensor electronics. For data traceability only. Not necessary for data processing.

CONF_PARAM_214.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The Medium gain stage offset internally applied in the MPE optical sensor electronics. For data traceability only. Not necessary for data processing.

CONF_PARAM_215.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The Low gain stage offset internally applied in the MPE optical sensor electronics. For data traceability only. Not necessary for data processing.

CONF_PARAM_257.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Payload sensor miscellaneous static configuration parameter
CONF_PARAM_257.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The Apf frame definition allows for a variable number of spectrometer pixels (also called channels) to be included in the frame. The two pixel values are configured indirectly via the wavelength range of the spectrum to be output (Suna Hardware Manual, section 4.2.3, input/output configuration parameters, data wavelength low/high.) The firmware converts the wavelength values to spectrometer pixels.

CONF_PARAM_258.CONF_PARAM_MSG_LABEL: Payload sensor miscellaneous static configuration parameter
CONF_PARAM_258.CONF_PARAM_DESCRIPTION: The Apf frame definition allows for a variable number of spectrometer pixels (also called channels) to be included in the frame. The two pixel values are configured indirectly via the wavelength range of the spectrum to be output (Suna Hardware Manual, section 4.2.3, input/output configuration parameters, data wavelength low/high.) The firmware converts the wavelength values to spectrometer pixels.
